Definition.WordDefinition: Rutherford, NJ (borough, FIPS 65280) Location: 40.81985 N, 74.10705 W Population (1990): 17790 (7220 housing units) Area: 7.3 sq km (land), 0.3 sq km (water) Zip code(s): 07070 Rutherford, PA (CDP, FIPS 66864) Location: 40.26885 N, 76.76820 W Population (1990): 3481 (1404 housing units) Area: 3.0 sq km (land), 0.0 sq km (water) Rutherford, TN (town, FIPS 65760) Location: 36.12542 N, 88.99279 W Population (1990): 1303 (590 housing units) Area: 5.8 sq km (land), 0.0 sq km (water) Zip code(s): 38369

rutherford n 1: a unit strength of a radioactive source equal to one million disintegrations per second 2: British chemist who isolated nitrogen (1749-1819) [syn: {Daniel Rutherford}] 3: British physicist (born in New Zealand) who discovered the atomic nucleus and proposed a nuclear model of the atom (1871-1937) [syn: {Ernest Rutherford}, {First Baron Rutherford}, {First Baron Rutherford of Nelson}]
